On Monday, December 10th at 6:00 p.m. in the Warren Miller Performing Arts Center, Big Sky School District is hosting a round table discussion regarding the challenges facing our adolescent and pre-adolescent students in the 21st century.

Come hear our counselors( Ms Wright and Ms Frounfelker), Gallatin County Deputy and BSSD School Resource Officer Travis Earl and legal expert Matt Dodd present on the different facets of growing up in today’s world. We hope to cover: the risks associated with drug and alcohol use and abuse; excessive gaming and the effect on the brain; the excessive use of vaping products nationwide; social media do’s and don’t’s; and what part parents can play to support the healthy decision making of their students.

Spring Break Ski Camp for locals at Big Sky Resort:
This year, our local school spring break overlaps with the last week of our winter season here at Big Sky Resort. In response to significant interest from local families, we have created our first ever Spring Break Ski Camp!



· Monday through Friday

· 9:45am to 3:15pm (Same meeting and pick-up area as earlier programs)

· Groupings will be made by age/ability, if you have any special requests then please include them with your registration.

· Cost for this program is $275 (bring your own lunch) or $325 with lunch included.

· Kids 10 and under ski free while in lessons, Kids 11 and older will need a pass or lift ticket

· Sign-up in person at the Mountain Sports Office or by calling (406)995-5743

· Registration deadline is Saturday, April 14th



We are excited to see how this program works, and hopefully we will be able to offer it again next season!

Hello, Big Sky Community!

If you are looking for a great way to kick off the weekend with the whole family, then come on down to the Lone Peak High School gymnasium this Friday, December 15th. Come offer your support for our boys and girls varsity basketball teams as they take on White Sulphur Springs in the first home game of the 2017 season. Both teams will be looking to keep their undefeated records alive, and they would both appreciate your support. Let's truly give them the home-court advantage, and get loud for the Bighorns!

The JV boys game starts at 4:00 pm. The varsity boys tip off at 5:30 pm, followed by the varsity girls team at 7:00 pm. Don't forget your blue and white!

GO BIGHORNS!

-Coach Barth
-Coach Hannahs
-Coach Cole
